Strategically, we will respond minimally to a release. Under this plan we will call emergency personnel and evacuate the facility. All response activities would be done in coordination with the Local Fire Department and their Hazardous Materials Response Team. 

Every year we review with our employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including a hazardous chemical release.

1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Sun Valley Packing has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, Sun Valley Packing continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.

By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Sun Valley Packing's ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Sun Valley Packing's management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.

Sun Valley Packing has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.

In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Sun Valley Packing has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation.

1.3 General Accident Release & Chemical Specific Prevention Steps

1.3.1 General 

We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meeting we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.

Sun Valley Packing has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the ammonia refrigeration process. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in PSMWriter and hard copy binders. 

1.3.2 Anhydrous Ammonia

The ammonia refrigeration process at the Sun Valley Packing facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year. It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.

Our refrigeration personnel monitor the ammonia refrigeration process and keep an active log book of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia. In addition, the process is checked frequently by one of the outside refrigeration contractors that we use. These contractors also assist in performing the annual mechanical integrity inspection of our ammonia equipment. 

1.4 Five Year Accident History

Sun Valley Packing has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.

1.5 Emergency Action and Response Plan

Sun Valley Packing's emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:
- California Emergency Action Plan - Title 8 CCR §3220
- Federal Emergency Action Plan - Title 29 CFR §1910.38 
- California Hazardous Waste Operat

The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures and practices that will help our employees and neighbors protect themselves.

1.2 Process Description

Facility Layout

Sun Valley Packing operates a commercial cold storage for tree fruit in Reedley, CA. The facility has an ammonia refrigeration system that provides refrigeration capacity to the following:

(2) Machinery Rooms
(1) Electrical Room
(6) Rooms
(4) Precool Rooms
(1) Shipping Dock
(1) Hallway
(2) Sheds
(6) Hydrocoolers

Facility Location

Sun Valley Packing is located at 7381 Avenue 432, Reedley, CA 93654. The latitude and longitude of the high pressure receiver is 36.574488, -119.409803. The facility is located approximately 7 miles west of state highway 63 in a rural area surrounded primarily by agriculture land.

According to FEMA Flood Map Service, the facility is not located in a special flood hazard area.
Sun Valley Packing is not located in an Alquist-Priolo Fault Zone as defined by the California Department of Conservation. In addition, a review of United States Geological Survey (USGS) fault maps revealed that there are no faults in close proximity to the site. The USGS 2018 One-Year Model revealed that Sun Valley Packing had a <1% chance of experiencing potentially minor-damage due to ground shaking in 2018.
 
Description of Covered Process

The refrigerated spaces and hydrocooler are equipped with air-cooling evaporators (water-cooling evaporators for the hydrocooler) and accumulators as required for flooded operation.

Most control valve groups are located on the roof to provide easy access. The refrigeration machinery is contained within or directly above the machinery rooms.

1. Executive Summary

This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:
- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program - Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5
- Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) - Title 40 CFR §68
- California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR §5189
- Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR §1910.119

Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.

This program is intended to be a living document. As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Sun Valley Packing has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 

1.1 Sun Valley Packing, Risk and Process Safety Management Program

This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Sun Valley Packing has updated/developed their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following process which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 

Process Name           | Process Chemical           | Process Quantity(lbs.)
Ammonia Refrigeration    Anhydrous Ammonia            41,000

Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses and physical property damage.

Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. We have: 
1. Prepared a unified program based on the PSM plan to meet CalARP and RMP obligations as well
